metadata.dc:author: Gutierrez De Aranguren, Cf
Gutiérrez Ccencho, C
Soto Tarazona, A
Revoredo, Fernando
Luna Cydejko, Jc
Olazábal Ramírez, V
metadata.dc:description: The persistence of the onphalomesenteric duct has been reported in several pediatric publications either through the appearance of Meckel diverticulum that are commonest, or by the appearance of segments with partial or total permeability of itself. Sporadic cases have appeared where this anomaly has originated episodes of intestinal obstruction in infants and children specially under the form of a fibrous band. However, adult presentations extremely infrequent. The case presented in this report shows compatible findings with a onphalomesenteric conduit with partial permeability, that I originate an intestinal picture of obstruction in a young adult.
metadata.dc:title: Persistencia de conducto onfalomesentérico como causa de obstruccion intestinal en el adulto. Reporte de un caso en el Hospital Nacional Hipolito Unanue.
[Persistence [corrected] of onphalomesenteric duct as intestinal obstruction cause in a adult. Report of a case in the Hipolito Unanue Nacional Hospital].
metadata.dc:publisher: Revista de gastroenterologia del Peru : organo oficial de la Sociedad de Gastroenterologia del Peru
